text:
Welcome to How To Cook That I am Ann Reardon
today we are making a layered cake with lemon

curd gel, strawberry mousse topped with strawberries
and toasted italian meringue.
This is such a delicious cake.

Firstly you are going to need to make two
8" round sponge cakes.

Then once they're cooled level off the tops
and cut each one into two layers.

And the recipe for that sponge cake and video
is on the website.

Now let's make the lemon gel and the strawberry
mousse.

You will need eggs, powdered sugar, butter,
cornflour, gelatin measured out into two bowls
and fresh lemon juice.

You can find all of those recipe quantities
and the recipe and video for the sponge cake

on the website how to cook that.net And I
will link to that in the description below
this video.

Mix the gelatin with some lemon juice that
is at room temperature.
You don't need to heat it up.

Stir it through well and then we will just
leave those so the gelatin will absorb that
moisture and soften up.

Place the rest of the juice, into a saucepan,
then add the butter,

powdered sugar,
eggs
and the cornflour.

Whisk it all together and then continue to
whisk that over the heat.

First thing that will happen is the butter
will melt but it will still be a liquid watery
consistency like this.

Keep stirring it over the heat and it will
thicken up.

It is important that you stir it the whole
time so you don't get any lumps.
And it will start to thicken up.

Once it starts to bubble keep stirring it
for about 30 seconds more just to make sure

all the eggs are cooked and the cornflour
is cooked as well.
Split that evenly between two bowls.

Then add the smaller lump of gelatin into
one bowl and stir stir stir and stir some
more until all the gelatin is melted.
Then set that to one side.

Take two punnetts of strawberries and wash
an hull them, take the green bit off.

You'll remember a few weeks ago I showed you
how to make your own poppin cookin kit.

And I asked you which youtuber did you want
me to send a kit to.

We read through all of your requests and mailed
it off overseas to all the way to LA toStrawburry17.

If you haven't met Strawburry17 before she
does videos ranging from cosplay to gameplay
and even poppin cookin videos.

I'll link you to the video of her making the
mini cake kit at the end of this one and in

the description below so make sure you check
that out too.

Add the larger lump of gelatin to the second
bowl of lemon curd.

Stir it through until the gelatin melts just
like we did before.

Now pour that into a blender and add the strawberries
on top.

Turn it on and blend blend blend blend until
it is smooth and nice and strawberry pink.

In a clean bowl pour in your cream and whip
with electric mixers.

Now I get a lot of questions about what cream
to use - it is called so many different names

all around the world so I've made a page on
the website to explain which cream you should

pick for this recipe and I'll link to that
below as well.

Once you can see the pattern of the beaters
in the cream that is good.

Pour in the cooled strawberry mixture and
fold it through.

It is important that his mixture is at room
temperature,it shouldn't feel hot or cold.
Otherwise if it is hot it will melt the cream.

Line an 8" round container with non-stick
baking paper at the base and around the edges,

allowing it to come up higher than the edges
of the container.

Add your first layer of sponge cake to the
bottom then pour on half a cup of lemon curd
gel.
Use a spoon to spread it to the edges.
Then add two cups of strawberry mousse.
Then the next layer of sponge.

And repeat those layers adding lemon curd
gel followed by strawberry mousse all the

way up to the top then add a thin layer of
strawberry mousse on the very top to stop
that cake drying out.

Tap it on the bench to level it off then place
it in the fridge to set for at least 3 hours,
you can leave it overnight if you want.

Scrape the last bit of strawberry mousse out
of the bowl onto a silpat and spread it super
thin like paper.

Place it in a slow oven for 40 minutes and
it will dehydrate and go crisp like this.

Place it in a sealed container because it
will soften in the air.

Then we need to make our topping place the
sugar and water into a saucepan and stir until
the sugar is dissolved.

Wash down the sides of your pan with some
water on a pastry brush to get any sugar crystals

because otherwise they will make your sugar
syrup crystalize out and go crunchy which
is not what we want.

Then add a candy thermometer and continue
to heat that unstirred.

Turn your beaters on to whip the egg whites
while the sugar syrup is heating and once

your sugar syrup reaches 238 degrees F or
114C

Pour it into the egg whites, with the beaters
still running.

Continue to beat it until the sides of the
bowl feel cooled down.
And this might take about 5 or 6 minutes.

Now once your mousse is set, fold the top
of the paper down and turn the whole thing
upside down.

Lift up the plastic container to slide it
off and then
peel the paper off the base.

Add your plate to the bottom of the dessert
and flip it back over the right way up.

Now carefully unwrap it and peel the baking
paper off the sides.

Now to decorate it spread some italian meringue
on top and pile on the strawberries.

Add more italian meringue and toast it using
a brulee torch.

Add more strawberries and pistachio nuts to
the top and then pieces of the dehydrated
mousse that we made before.

Slice generous portions and enjoy the moist
fresh strawberry lemony flavours.

Share the video with a friend you'd like to
bake with, or as a hint for someone to make
it for you.

Subscribe to How To Cook That for more crazy
sweet creations click here to see the rest

of my videos and here to check out strawburry17
making my mini cake kit and subscribe to her
channel too.
Have a great week and I'll see you Friday.

[music: the boat song by youtube.com/setsailtv
used with permission]
